item.title: Immortals lose to Birmingham 41-0
item.author: Samuel J P Hill,
item.description: Valentines Day was a special day in every Immortal’s heart this year as it saw us travel to Birmingham to take on the best team in the country. After taking five hours to get to the pitch after multiple motorway closures and heavy traffic on Country Roads, the mood on the bus was a little down but …

item.title: Immortals lose at home to Hurricanes 24-6
item.author: Samuel J P Hill,
item.description: Sunday 8th February saw the Imperial Immortals clash with the Hertfordshire Hurricanes at Fortress Harlington. Earlier in the season the Immortals put in a great second half and lost 22-12 after some inspired work from Bob WorksFromHomeAlone2:LostInNewYork with the quarterback sneak of legend. …

item.title: Immortals win on Super Bowl Sunday
item.author: Samuel J P Hill,
item.description: Sunday 1st February saw the Immortals take a trip to the seaside to face Brighton Tsunami for the second time in the season. The first time saw the Immortals dominate with a 12-6 win at home. The team all packed onto the coach at 8am for the two-hour drive to Brighton; looking ready to take the …

item.title: Imperial Immortals put up a good fight in their first away game
item.author: Samuel J P Hill,
item.description: Sunday 16th November brought the Imperial Immortals’ first away game of the season against the Hertfordshire Hurricanes. The Hurricanes are an impressive team that made the semi-finals last season, the same as the Immortals. This was an important match for both teams as the Immortals were looking to …

item.title: Immortals win 12-6 in first mates of the season
item.author: Samuel J P Hill,
item.description: Saturday 8th November brought the Imperial Immortals American Football Club’s first game of the season against Brighton Tsunami. It was a home game at the ‘Runway’ Harlington and from the start the Immortals came out strong and dominated on defence shutting down Brighton on their first drive. This …
